column2: Bill, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I believe this medicine is a "God-send" for me.  I can now do things that are a common activity for most people.  I've always dealt with some type of anxiety in new or social situations.  Now taking 1MG of Xanax XR my nervousness and anxiety are gone.  If I have a day that I know will be long I have a smaller prescription of the 2mg pill and this last all day. column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
girl87, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed with a panic/anxiety disorder approximately 8 yrs ago. I have tried every type of drug possible to calm me down & nothing worked. Finally, after seeing a psychiatrist he prescribed the regular xanax 1.0mg (3 per day). As, a worry wart that I am, I refused to take 3 a day for the fear of dependancy. I would only take 1 per day & at the most 1 1/2 per day, which did help with the calming. Then about 3 months ago he decided to try the xanax xr 3mg per day. After a week of that, I found I was so sleepy! I went from climbing the walls to sleeping all the time. The dose was way to much for me. So, after the 1st month he lowered it to 2mg per day & so far it has been much better. As we all know these kind of meds can become addictive & that was just another thing I had to worry about, but I finally tried to use the power of my mind to NOT let myself get addicted to them, and I also look at it this way. If I can live close to a somewhat normal life again instead of being a figity hermit, then I am all for it. So far I can say that I am not 100% my normal self, but this is the closest I have been to it in the last 8yrs! I would definetly try it, if you got anxiety & don't worry about the addictiveness. If you got a good dr. that will watch you closely & that you are not abusing them, I think you will be fine! Life is to short to not enjoy it like you once did, so I say give it a shot & try it. If someone would've told me they had panic/anxiety attks 10+ yrs ago, I would've thought they were crazy! Trust me, they are scarey, they are very real, & I don't wish them on anyone. But, I am VERY thankful that I have finally found something to take the edge off!!

column9: I have been on Xanax XR 2mg for about 3 years now. I worked my way up to this dosage during the 2 years prior. I had tried almost every medicine available, all with terrible side effects. I also do not drink, so I have no problems with it making me feel dizzy or "out of it". If you take this Rx as directed, you will not abuse it. column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have taken Xanax for years. Yes, it was my miracle pill. I was able to function in ways I hadnt been able to before. BUT my experience took a turn for the worse. I ended up in the hospital twice in one week because I had seizures due to lowering my dose. I became highly addicted. Because of the seizures my doctor decided I should try to stop completely. Weaning off of course but I might as well have gone cold turkey. The withdrawl symptoms are horrible. I couldnt sleep, eat, think clearly, i was throwing up all the time. My body hurt. I was frustrated. My anxiety was ten times worse than it had ever been. Take my advice, stay away, find another alternative. Xanax will ruin your life in the long run. I have been off Xanax for over 2 months now and still experiece horrible side affects. I have terrible headaches EVERYDAY. I still feel so sick to my stomach all the time and usually end up throwing up. I have researed it over and over again. This can last for up to 18 months. I have been unemployed throughout this process because i cant seem to leave my house. it has ruined me. Coming back from this is so hard. im doing my best. If i had known that i would go through all of this I NEVER would have taken it in the first place. If you HAVE to have something try Klonopin. (not sure if i spelled that right) it is so much better for you. its in the same family of xanax but not so addictive. it gives you the same benefits. i just want everyone to know that xanax is horrible. these educated doctors who prescribe it are wrong, they know what it does and still prescribe. shame on them. Its not worth it...just my opinion but seriously think of the long term affects first.

column2: Wulfbringer, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been using the 2mg XR for anxiety/panic attacks for almost 4 years now. I am greatful for this drug; I feel comfortable in large crowds unlike before. I feel like I am relaxed throughout the day, and don't worry as much as before I started taking this drug. There have been a few times when my script has lapsed before my regular doctor's visit, and just for the few days of not taking it I haven't really experienced any serious side effects. I used to grind my teeth at night and constantly waking up through the night with my fists clinched up, or just not being able to sleep at all. Overall, I feel great, not always feeling anxious or panicing about the daily grind at work. I work in a restuarant, and was always getting stressed very easily. This drug has turned my life around for me. I also suffer from chronic migraines triggered by stress, this has also helped keep my stress level down to help prevent the frequency of those migraines. As with any drug, this is not for everyone. It works for me.

column2: Milo, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have generalized anxiety disorder and have been on benzodiazepine therapy for 25 years now. What I like about Xanax XR compared to some other drugs in this class is that it stays in the system, continuously working all day, so I don't have to worry about taking my next dose on time, for example if I'm stuck on a delayed flight. The downside is that since I have been on these medications for so long, my psychiatrist (a specialist in psycho-pharmacology) has told me I will need to take this for life. That's fine with me; I look at it just like medication for diabetes or high blood pressure. Anyway, that would be the case with any benzodiazepine. I'm functioning well and sleeping well, taking 4-5 mg. per day for several years now.

column2: Xanax, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I HIGHLY discourage any person from using this drug. Regardless of how anxious you may feel or if you have panic attacks, DON'T take it. I was on it for 6 months when prescribed by my family medicine doctor for occassional anxiety; I later went to the head phycologist at a nationally renound hospital in Washington. He is a lead prof in the School of Medicine, Phycology department. My new doctor spends 1 full day of class lecture on Xanax alone, and why NOT to prescribe it! This is serious...I attempted to stop taking the medication; only to find you have a serious risk of having a seizure and cannot stop cold turkey. The withdrawls are HORRIBLE, and you must wean yourself off Xanax! Because I was only on it for 6 months I went from 4pm/day to 2mg/day for 1 week, 1mg/day for 1 week, then .5mg/day for the last week and still had serious withdrawls. My doctor said patients who are on Xanax for longer periods of time, 2 years+, it can take them up to a year to get off it! And you can't rebound or relapse, you'll do nothing but hurt yourself even more! Even if you do take it to get rid of anxiety, it will get worse because your body becomes quickly dependant and immune to it, requiring higher dosages.I do not blog or post online, but I had to spread the word. I am an honors students, very stable, no drug addictions or problems, just a normal guy; so those who are prone to relapse or abuse Xanax, BE AWARE. Bottom line; in no circumstance take Xanax, if you're on it currently the best of luck getting off! Do as you wish, but thought I'd let you in on a little secret.

column2: amberkey, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: i am 22 and was prescribed xanax at 16 i became very dependent and it quit working no matter how high the dose. i have chronic agoraphobia and anxiety and this has taken away the dependency and aloud me to function and leave the house.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed with severe anxiety a couple months ago.  I tried buspar and zoloft and both gave me horrible side effects.  I loved Xanax but hated how sleepy it made me.  My doctor prescribed Xanax XR and it has worked great. I can concentrate throughout the day, I don't constantly worry anymore, I feel much more like the way I did before my panic attacks.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Well i have small children and it has pretty much stopped my attacks and does not make me drowsy. I feel normal again

column2: lissa_0270, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been on xanax for 12 yrs. I was put on the XR 3mg, about 1yr ago. I feel relaxed and not so stressed, no more ups & downs!! I would definatly recommend this to anyone that is on the Reg xanax to try (The XR does not have the same effect of calming down in 15mins,Your calm ALL day.) But I still have trouble sleeping!? Just a night owl I guess.   I hope this was helpfull.

column2: keis02, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My doctor prescribed this for me to help me unwind in the evening. I take it before bed and it helps me to stop worrying about everything that happened that day.  It does have a calming effect for me. Nice.

column2: deegirl, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I use xanax .05 only when necessary and I find that it really works...about the only thing that does...I've taken celexa and then lexapro and they weren't that effective for panic...unless you take a moderate to high dose and who can afford to be sleeping all the time and deal with the side effects....I chose to get off the antidepressants and try diet, vitamin therapy and exercise for my disorder..hopefully this will work..

column2: bessvann, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been suffering, and I mean suffering, from panic attacks for the past several months.  I have never had this condition before.  I was placed on Xanax XR about a week ago, but I am afraid to take it at work as I have to be on my feet and interacting with the public (ugh) 8-10 hours per day.  Any suggestions or warnings?

column2: glenn, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: 10 years of extreme anxiety, trying just about everything, and so far this medication seems to be working best. No more attacks every single day :)

column2: Leisa, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have a terrible time with anexiety and panic attacks.  This drug has changed my life.  I can attend social gatherings.  My husband couldn't believe the difference in me once I started using this medication.
